intro: Sisymbrium pinnatifidum var. boryanum, commonly known as the Boryanum tansy, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it both a potential weed and a subject of ecological study.
